item.description:
The sugar house is in a homeowner's back yard in a residential section of North Andover, just off Salem St.  They usually put a sign out on the corner of Salem St. and Turtle Ln. when they're boiling, so it's a bit easier to find.

Turtle Lane has formally scheduled us as a group, so I've removed the attendance cap.  Parking is somewhat tight, so carpool where possible -- post where you're driving from and how many you can take.  There is no easy public transit to this location.

In the past, nearby restaurants have had dishes made with Turtle Lane syrup.  I don't know if that's the case this year, but if it is, there may be a lunch run to one of those restaurants afterward.  Last year's restaurants included The Loft and Mad Maggie's Ice Cream, both in North Andover.

Turtle Lane hasn't announced they're boiling yet, but the weather all week looks about perfect for sap running, so I expect they'll be boiling the entire weekend.  I'll send out updates if they won't be boiling at the scheduled time.

Turtle Lane website: http://turtlelanemaplefarm.com/

Map and driving directions: http://turtlelanemaplefarm.com/driving-directions/
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be standing out front with a Meetup logo button on.
item.why: It's maple sugaring season! Turtle Lane is the best maple sugar house tour I've seen, with lots of detail about the process and tastings at multiple points.
item.name: Maple sugaring tour at Turtle Lane Maple Farm
